description: CIHR seeks expertise for the planning and evaluation of its Clinical Trials Fund (CTF) program through an integrated, collaborative approach.
full_summary:
**Evaluation of CIHR’s Clinical Trials Fund (CTF) – Request for Proposal**

**Reference Number:** cb-987-68777686

**Tender Status:** Expired

**Supply Category:** Business and Corporate Management Consultation Services and Project Monitoring/Evaluation

**Canadian Free Trade Agreements (FTA):** This tender is open to participants from the following countries: Canada, Peru, Korea, the European Union, Colombia, Panama, Mexico, and the countries part of the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

**Region of Delivery:** National Capital Region (NCR), Canada

**Notice Description:**
The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) is seeking a consultant to conduct the evaluation of the Clinical Trials Fund (CTF) program. The evaluation will be conducted through a collaborative approach and will involve planning, document review, data collection, and report preparation.

**Key Responsibilities:**
The selected consultant will be responsible for:

1. Developing an evaluation design report (EDR), including an evaluation matrix, and methodology for the evaluation.
2. Collecting and analyzing data to address the evaluation questions.
3. Preparing and administering data collection instruments.
4. Conducting an analysis and reporting the findings in an evaluation report.

**Preferred Qualifications:**
The ideal candidate will have expertise in business and corporate management consulting, as well as project monitoring and/or evaluation. A strong understanding of the healthcare sector and clinical trials is also desirable.

**Requirements:**

* The consultant must be competent in French and/or English, equivalent to a B2 level (bachelor’s degree in French and/or English as a second language).
* The consultant must be familiar with the principles of evaluation and have experience in conducting evaluations.
* The consultant must be able to communicate complex evaluation information in clear and concise terms.

**Procurement Method:** Competitive – Selective Tendering

**Selection Criteria:**
The best proposal will be selected based on the combination of technical merit and price.

**Proposal Submissions:**
Proposals must be received by June 20, 2024, 14:00 (ET) and can be submitted electronically. The evaluation process will begin immediately thereafter, and proposals will be reviewed based on the criteria and requirements mentioned above.

Contact Information:
Zoe Barr, Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR)
Email: [zoe.barr@cihr-irsc.gc.ca](mailto:zoe.barr@cihr-irsc.gc.ca)
